import React, { Component } from 'react' import { Link } from 'react-router-dom' class NavBar extends Component { render() { /* If the route url matches the url for specified routes, that route button will recieve the active class, which distinguishes the route the user is on. */ const homeClass = this.props.location.pathname === '/' ? 'btn navbar-brand active' : 'btn' const searchClass = this.props.location.pathname === '/search' ? 'btn active' : 'btn' const discoverClass = this.props.location.pathname === '/discover' ? 'btn active' : 'btn' const mapClass = this.props.location.pathname === '/map' ? 'btn active' : 'btn' const profileClass = this.props.location.pathname === '/profile' ? 'btn active' : 'btn' const loginClass = this.props.location.pathname === '/login' ? 'btn active' : 'btn' const navClass = this.props.collapsed ? "navbar-collapse collapse" : "navbar-collapse"; return (
Countries
Search Discover My Map Profile
{ !this.props.authenticated ? Login : Logout }
) } } export default NavBar;
